posts.name: Michelle
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.46 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

★ Lotttts of background work

Complete list of new commits since 7.45.3:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.45.3…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.45 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.46.0 (155500)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

37 new commits since 7.45.3:

Show commits

  • Use now for watermarking. [1]

  • Allow different accounts on same Google account to subscribe to backups. [2]

  • Update notification message for large backup attachment uploads. [3]

  • Do not check if purchase was within last month. [4]

  • Fix resource leaks when uploading backup attachments. [5]

  • Improve display of backup details when upload is in progress. [6]

  • Keep screen on and hold wake lock during important parts of backup restore. [7]

  • Add additional backup screen states. [8]

  • Add proper turn off backups string for paid tier. [9]

  • Prevent trailing whitespace from being considered an edit. [10]

  • Change re-enable button color to Tonal. [11]

  • Utilize ImageVector instead of Painter in SettingsScaffold. [12]

  • Don't keep screen on for voice calls. [13]

  • Convert AdvancedPinPreferencesFragment to compose. [14]

  • Show credit card input as LTR even for RTL languages. [15]

  • Prevent notification sound when voice recording. [16]

  • Update okhttp mockserver to 5.0.0-alpha.16 [17]

  • Use different icon for 'fetching messages'. [18]

    Relates to #12904

  • Show verified safety number users in New Chat selection screen. [19]

  • Add enable contact permission banner when adding members to groups. [20]

  • Add wiring and notification for out of remote space error. [21]

  • Avoid uploading onboarding story media during restore. [22]

  • Move some cipher finalization into close() instead of flush(). [23]

  • Convert AttachmentCipherOutputStream to kotlin. [24]

  • Convert AttachmentCipherInputStream to kotlin. [25]

  • Add logging to debug flipping from broken camera [26]

  • Fix contact receive desugar crash on Android 6. [27]

  • Refactor AttachmentCipherInputStream. [28]

  • Add deprecation notification when build expires. [29]

  • Improve message notification determination. [30]

  • Add custom 404 retry logic. [31]

  • Sync backup tier to account record. [32]

  • Fix alignment in group title. [33]

  • Fix legacy restore options in new restore flows. [34]

  • Adjust iDEAL string. [35]

  • Update translations and other static files. [36]

  • Bump version to 7.46.0 [37]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.45.3…v7.46.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

link_counts.title: Get the latest Android releases even faster with Firebase App Distribution

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
More delayed notifications now happening on my Pixel 8 Pro

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.46.0/8a31be44542639662d06111999ee29b8b75c56e257cf81d9e86a15ef2ad86cc0

Sent: 1750318173583
Received 12 minutes later

Gonna be moving to websocket :(

Checking the logs, Signal is completely inactive during the duration of time my message is delayed here.

Continuing the discussion from Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.45 release:

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.45 release

Just checking my understanding: currently your backups is disabled but when you go to enable it, you are unable to select a folder because the file system isn’t loading?

Yes this is correct

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.45 release

posts.cooked:
stories are not sent to other contacts: waiting for…1 hour and more.
https://debuglogs.org/android/7.46.0/cd8cc65a9051eaa06ed514e8d0521290e1ced67ab99839047c70e60920959558

posts.name: Michelle
posts.cooked: Interesting, the logs indicate that one of the people you tried to send it to is no longer registered? Is that possible?

there is a contact who no longer had Signal and whom I deleted from the app. I don’t have to figure out, before sending a story, who might still have Signal and who might not: I have to be able to send the story and that’s it, then whoever has Signal gets it if they don’t pass it on to others. Conversely, it’s a no-brainer if one or more contacts who no longer have Signal have to block sending to legitimate users

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
It isn’t possible to set a profile picture at the moment.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.46.0/3aa98b89b85d7d1d17a8d85a8c94b98e1c174fbc20eeb8a0b81cbeda8e08a44c

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
A contact tried to video call me right after I closed the app (not force close, just returned to my homescreen) and I didn’t get any notification or ring.

Their logs: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.45.3/61012b519eddc619dd7cd6bb932ecf67cd4baa739143cb7bc3f8d2a39bade449
My logs: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.46.0/f0a8a2893b4254b0b75b005793c32a1639d1d748eb6d93c25186ac88be6e1d60

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
I’m unable to change the photo of a group chat. I’m not the admin, but I was able to update the group description with no problem. I get a “Problem setting profile” error when attempting to set a photo.

Logs: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.46.0/74a259aa76a7aedc7588d4d44b7c2b98f16bfd4322fec7ef99d16541d2ddfc58

signal-2025-06-21-17-11-19-2471024×2299 80.1 KB

I had a “checking for messages” notification for some minutes. It went away when I opened the app. In the meantime I had gotten a message on desktop and also answered there.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.46.0/64812606aead4cbf9518868daddf343a56d3adbf79ba3e74e86de1839f3be6b2

posts.name: Michelle
posts.cooked:
Salt505:

I’m unable to change the photo of a group chat

Whatnoww:

It isn’t possible to set a profile picture at the moment

Ah, sorry about that. We should have that fixed in 7.46.1.

Salt505:

A contact tried to video call me right after I closed the app

Tracking. Actually do you have a rough timestamp for this call?

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
mtang-signal:

Actually do you have a rough timestamp for this call?

The call was made right before the message with the ID 1750515266626 (at around 10:14 AM EDT)

posts.name: AlertSubject
posts.cooked:
Not getting notifications at all rn
Even after reboot / force stop etc

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.46.0/148be91550f3f06ce036676f65d25c76fb655140801f96fe528e81b928febf69

Edit: notifications from other apps still work, my news app sent a successful notification

posts.name: Cody Henthorne
posts.cooked:
AlertSubject:

Not getting notifications at all rn

It looks like we are getting very delayed push notifications for periods of time that’s keep us from getting to run a fetch messages. The delay is in milliseconds and you can see that some were delayed over an hour.

image1663×977 372 KB

When we do get a notification it seems like we spin up and fetch things as expected and give notifications to the OS to show.

New Version: 7.46.1 (155600)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

4 new commits since 7.46.0:

  • Fix bug where network sink would sometimes be closed early. [1]

  • Update translations and other static files. [2]

  • Update baseline profile. [3]

  • Bump version to 7.46.1 [4]

link_counts.title: Get the latest Android releases even faster with Firebase App Distribution

posts.cooked: Just to add. Notification delay has been terrible even with the last two stable versions so this isn’t particularly a beta problem, it seems. I had filed a report (with debug logs) for the stable release via the form on the website.

Another one. The ‘checking for messages’ notification did not go away until I opened the app. I had received a message and read it on desktop, ID 1750772860071

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.46.1/fd55da3087666df558205cf531e6f949acce0e25a683f7271dd06e6f8bc518a9

posts.name: Cody Henthorne
posts.cooked:
throwaway1:

Notification delay has been terrible even with the last two stable versions so this isn’t particularly a beta problem, it seems. I had filed a report (with debug logs) for the stable release via the form on the website.

Feel free to repost logs here and include a rough time where you noticed the poor behavior.

FluffyPotato:

The ‘checking for messages’ notification did not go away until I opened the app. I had received a message and read it on desktop, ID 1750772860071

Thanks for the logs and timestamp, you have the beginning of a thread I can pull on thanks. Will pull on it shortly.
I am still on 7.40.2 for reasons. And I don’t have delayed messages. So I will probably stay with that old version, as it seems to work better. Maybe I can suggest you victims to downgrade?
